text: In vivo studies of the activity of four of the kinases, KinA, KinC, KinD (ykvD) and KinE (ykrQ), using abrB transcription as an indicator of Spo0A~P level, revealed that KinC and KinD were responsible for Spo0A~P production during the exponential phase of growth in the absence of KinA and KinB.
text_with_entity_marker: In vivo studies of the activity of four of the kinases, KinA, KinC, KinD (ykvD) and KinE (ykrQ), using abrB transcription as an indicator of Spo0A~P level, revealed that [E1]KinC[/E1] and KinD were responsible for [E2]Spo0A~P[/E2] production during the exponential phase of growth in the absence of KinA and KinB.

text: Both SigK and GerE were essential for ykvP expression, and this gene was transcribed from T5 of sporulation.
text_with_entity_marker: Both [E1]SigK[/E1] and [E2]GerE[/E2] were essential for ykvP expression, and this gene was transcribed from T5 of sporulation.

text: Both SigK and GerE were essential for ykvP expression, and this gene was transcribed from T5 of sporulation.
text_with_entity_marker: Both [E1]SigK[/E1] and GerE were essential for [E2]ykvP[/E2] expression, and this gene was transcribed from T5 of sporulation.

text: sigmaF is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAB, an anti-anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAA, and a membrane-bound phosphatase, SpoIIE, which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of SpoIIAA back to the active form.
text_with_entity_marker: sigmaF is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAB, an anti-anti-sigma factor, [E1]SpoIIAA[/E1], and a membrane-bound phosphatase, [E2]SpoIIE[/E2], which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of SpoIIAA back to the active form.

text: These results suggest that YfhP may act as a negative regulator for the transcription of yfhQ, yfhR, sspE and yfhP.
text_with_entity_marker: These results suggest that YfhP may act as a negative regulator for the transcription of [E1]yfhQ[/E1], yfhR, sspE and [E2]yfhP[/E2].

text: These results suggest that YfhP may act as a negative regulator for the transcription of yfhQ, yfhR, sspE and yfhP.
text_with_entity_marker: These results suggest that YfhP may act as a negative regulator for the transcription of yfhQ, yfhR, [E1]sspE[/E1] and [E2]yfhP[/E2].

text: A low level of GerE activated transcription of cotD by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed cotD transcription.
text_with_entity_marker: A low level of GerE activated transcription of [E1]cotD[/E1] by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of [E2]GerE[/E2] repressed cotD transcription.

text: These results suggest that a rising level of GerE in sporulating cells may first activate cotD transcription from the upstream site then repress transcription as the downstream site becomes occupied.
text_with_entity_marker: These results suggest that a rising level of [E1]GerE[/E1] in sporulating cells may first activate [E2]cotD[/E2] transcription from the upstream site then repress transcription as the downstream site becomes occupied.

text: ComK negatively controls the transcription of hag by stimulating the transcription of comF-flgM, thereby increasing the production of the FlgM antisigma factor that inhibits sigmaD activity.
text_with_entity_marker: [E1]ComK[/E1] negatively controls the transcription of hag by stimulating the transcription of [E2]comF[/E2]-flgM, thereby increasing the production of the FlgM antisigma factor that inhibits sigmaD activity.

text: ComK negatively controls the transcription of hag by stimulating the transcription of comF-flgM, thereby increasing the production of the FlgM antisigma factor that inhibits sigmaD activity.
text_with_entity_marker: ComK negatively controls the transcription of [E1]hag[/E1] by stimulating the transcription of [E2]comF[/E2]-flgM, thereby increasing the production of the FlgM antisigma factor that inhibits sigmaD activity.

text: Transcriptional studies showed that nadE is strongly induced in response to heat, ethanol and salt stress or after starvation for glucose in a sigma B-dependent manner.
text_with_entity_marker: Transcriptional studies showed that [E1]nadE[/E1] is strongly induced in response to heat, ethanol and salt stress or after starvation for glucose in a [E2]sigma B[/E2]-dependent manner.

text: Furthermore, YtxH and YvyD seemed to be induced after phosphate starvation in the wild type in a sigma(B)-dependent manner and in the sigB mutant probably via sigma(H).
text_with_entity_marker: Furthermore, YtxH and [E1]YvyD[/E1] seemed to be induced after phosphate starvation in the wild type in a [E2]sigma(B)[/E2]-dependent manner and in the sigB mutant probably via sigma(H).

text: The expression of the bkd operon was induced by the presence of isoleucine or valine in the growth medium and depended upon the presence of the sigma factor SigL, a member of the sigma 54 family.
text_with_entity_marker: The expression of the [E1]bkd[/E1] operon was induced by the presence of isoleucine or valine in the growth medium and depended upon the presence of the sigma factor [E2]SigL[/E2], a member of the sigma 54 family.

text: Transcription of the cotB, cotC, and cotX genes by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called GerE.
text_with_entity_marker: Transcription of the [E1]cotB[/E1], cotC, and [E2]cotX[/E2] genes by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called GerE.

text: In vitro transcription experiments suggest that the differential pattern of cot gene expression results from the combined action of GerE and another transcription factor, SpoIIID.
text_with_entity_marker: In vitro transcription experiments suggest that the differential pattern of cot gene expression results from the combined action of [E1]GerE[/E1] and another transcription factor, [E2]SpoIIID[/E2].

text: Primer extension experiments and Northern blot analysis show that an active sigmaA-dependent promoter precedes kdgR and transcription is terminated at the putative p-independent terminator downstream of kdgT.
text_with_entity_marker: Primer extension experiments and Northern blot analysis show that an active [E1]sigmaA[/E1]-dependent promoter precedes [E2]kdgR[/E2] and transcription is terminated at the putative p-independent terminator downstream of kdgT.

text: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both sigma(A) and sigma(X) holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the sigX-ypuN control region.
text_with_entity_marker: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both sigma(A) and [E1]sigma(X)[/E1] holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the [E2]sigX[/E2]-ypuN control region.

text: The results indicate that PhoP~P is sufficient to repress the transcription of the tagA and tagD promoters and also to activate the transcription of the tuaA promoter.
text_with_entity_marker: The results indicate that PhoP~P is sufficient to repress the transcription of the tagA and [E1]tagD[/E1] promoters and also to activate the transcription of the [E2]tuaA[/E2] promoter.

text: However, the mutant was unable to stimulate transcription by final sigma(A)-RNA polymerase from the Spo0A-dependent spoIIG operon promoter.
text_with_entity_marker: However, the mutant was unable to stimulate transcription by final [E1]sigma(A)[/E1]-RNA polymerase from the Spo0A-dependent [E2]spoIIG[/E2] operon promoter.

text: Our data demonstrate that the CtsR protein acts as a global repressor of the clpC operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the sigmaB- or sigmaA-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.
text_with_entity_marker: Our data demonstrate that the CtsR protein acts as a global repressor of the [E1]clpC[/E1] operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the [E2]sigmaB[/E2]- or sigmaA-dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.

text: The sigmaB-dependent promoter drives expression of yvyD under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a sigmaH-dependent promoter is responsible for yvyD transcription following amino acid limitation.
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]sigmaB[/E1]-dependent promoter drives expression of yvyD under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a sigmaH-dependent promoter is responsible for [E2]yvyD[/E2] transcription following amino acid limitation.

text: This indicates that the yvyD gene product, being a member of both the sigmaB and sigmaH regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the sigmaL regulon.
text_with_entity_marker: This indicates that the [E1]yvyD[/E1] gene product, being a member of both the [E2]sigmaB[/E2] and sigmaH regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the sigmaL regulon.

text: This indicates that the yvyD gene product, being a member of both the sigmaB and sigmaH regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the sigmaL regulon.
text_with_entity_marker: This indicates that the [E1]yvyD[/E1] gene product, being a member of both the sigmaB and sigmaH regulons, might negatively regulate the activity of the [E2]sigmaL[/E2] regulon.

text: The addition of ClpX to in vitro transcription reactions resulted in the stimulation of RNAP holoenzyme activity, but sigmaH-RNAP was observed to be more sensitive to ClpX-dependent stimulation than sigmaA-RNAP.
text_with_entity_marker: The addition of [E1]ClpX[/E1] to in vitro transcription reactions resulted in the stimulation of RNAP holoenzyme activity, but [E2]sigmaH[/E2]-RNAP was observed to be more sensitive to ClpX-dependent stimulation than sigmaA-RNAP.

text: The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; FlgM, present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor sigma 28; SpoIIAB, which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, sigma F and sigma G, of Bacillus subtilis; RbsW of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor sigma B; and DnaK, a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor sigma 32.

text: The sspH and sspL genes are recognized primarily by the forespore-specific sigma factor for RNA polymerase, sigmaG; the sspN-tlp operon is recognized equally well by sigmaG and the other forespore-specific sigma factor, sigmaF.

text: The sigma W regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (PBP4*) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (RacX), homologues of signal peptide peptidase (YteI), flotillin (YuaG), ABC transporters (YknXYZ), non-haem bromoperoxidase (YdjP), epoxide hydrolase (YfhM) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
